item.title: Bike shed on the bend which forces traffic on to wrong side of the road, 16th July
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious safety concern regarding the location of the bike shed currently placed on Sawyer Street, SE1. The shed is situated on a bend in the road which forces vehicles—particularly larger ones—to move into the opposite lane in order to safely navigate around it. This positioning puts them directly in the path of oncoming traffic. As the bend is effectively blind, drivers approaching from the opposite direction are unable to see these vehicles in time, creating a highly dangerous situation. This morning, I was nearly involved in a serious head-on collision with a van as a result of this exact issue. The van was forced onto my side of the road to avoid the bike shed, and due to the restricted visibility, we came extremely close to impact. Had the collision occurred, it would likely have resulted in significant damage to my vehicle and, potentially, serious injury to myself. I want to be clear that I fully support the use of bike sheds to encourage more sustainable and active modes of transport. However, in this case, the current location of the shed poses a genuine and unacceptable risk to all road users. I am not suggesting the removal of the bike shed, but rather that it be relocated to a safer position further down Sawyer Street—away from the bend and the associated blind spot. I urge the council to investigate this matter urgently and take appropriate action to prevent future accidents. Thank you for your attention to this important issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sawyer Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily litter on High Street, 16th July
item.description:
Shop and domestic waste is placed on High Street daily, directly onto street. Foxes rip open bags overnight and litter is strewn over street. Waste collectors clear this up around 9am, but this should not be happening. The council should provide somewhere permanent, hygienic and protected for residents and shop owners to place their waste. There is currently nowhere for them to do so. Fly tipping notices are not appropriate where the council is not providing a sensible alternative.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
